Subject: Re: [junit] Unit 4.0 release candidate 2 Test ordering
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=12653864; y=R_FPr2Zd0XoIGOfRLu2GAX2Sg10wMJBbvOc_iNLlRmC7nZvx

Cédric Beust ♔ wrote:

> I would argue that you are still wasting time since the report gives you 100
> tests to choose from, which is a bit silly since it knows *exactly* which
> one failed and *exactly* which ones were skipped.
> 
> Why would you prefer to read "101 tests failed" over "1 test failed, 100
> tests skipped"?


Because the sorts of problems that cause 90%+ of my tests to fail are 
radically different from the ones that cause one or a few tests to fail. 
  If I see 90%+ of my tests failing, I look for an unstarted web server, 
a network connection that went down, a compile error, a classpath 
mistake, some sort of problem in the infrastructure the tests depend on. 
If I see one test failed I look for a problem in the specific code that 
test depends on. I could easily miss the forest fire while looking 
closely at one tree. When I see 1001 tests failed, I know I should be 
looking at the forest.  When I see 1 test failed I know I should look at 
the tree.

--
